title: Wild West Bank Break-In Adventure #1
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Back Alley Behind the Bank
rooms.description: A dusty alley behind the Dusty Gulch Bank. The sun beats down on wooden crates and trash bins. A locked back door leads into the bank. You can hear the faint sound of a piano from the saloon next door.

items.name: old trash bin
items.description: A dented metal bin overflowing with garbage and discarded papers

items.name: crumpled note
items.description: A torn piece of paper with faded writing
items.text: Remember: Black Bart's bounty, then Mad Dog's bounty, then Rattlesnake Pete's bounty. That's the combination to the banker's desk.

items.name: stack of wooden crates
items.description: Several weathered crates stacked against the wall

items.name: rusty crowbar
items.description: A heavy iron crowbar, useful for prying things open

items.name: bank back door
items.description: A sturdy wooden door with a heavy lock. The wood around the lock looks weak.

rooms.name: Bank Manager's Office
rooms.description: A cramped office with a large oak desk, filing cabinets, and wanted posters covering the walls. Dust motes float in the light streaming through a barred window. The vault door looms on the east wall.

items.name: wanted poster for Black Bart
items.description: A weathered poster showing a bearded outlaw
items.text: WANTED: Black Bart - Bank Robbery, Horse Theft. REWARD: $500

items.name: wanted poster for Mad Dog Morgan
items.description: A poster depicting a wild-eyed gunslinger
items.text: WANTED: Mad Dog Morgan - Murder, Cattle Rustling. REWARD: $250

items.name: wanted poster for Rattlesnake Pete
items.description: A faded poster showing a sneering outlaw
items.text: WANTED: Rattlesnake Pete - Stagecoach Robbery. REWARD: $100

items.name: banker's oak desk
items.description: A heavy desk with three locked drawers and papers scattered across the top

items.name: vault access instructions
items.description: A confidential document with vault security protocols
items.text: VAULT ACCESS PROTOCOL: Security questions must be answered correctly. Q1: What town was robbed by the James Gang? Q2: Where do outlaws hide their gold? Q3: Who guards this bank?

items.name: bank ledger
items.description: A leather-bound book with transaction records
items.text: Recent deposits from Tombstone mining operations. Note: Sheriff Clayton requests we keep his name on all security documents as the official bank guardian.

items.name: metal filing cabinet
items.description: A tall cabinet with various files and documents

items.name: old newspaper clipping
items.text: TOMBSTONE GAZETTE: James Gang strikes again! The notorious outlaws robbed the Tombstone Bank last Tuesday, making off with $10,000 in gold. They are believed to be hiding in the canyon caves where many outlaws stash their stolen loot.

items.name: heavy vault door
items.description: A massive iron door with a complex locking mechanism. A brass panel displays three security questions.

password_questions.question: What town was robbed by the James Gang?
password_questions.hint: Check the newspaper clipping in the filing cabinet

password_questions.question: Where do outlaws hide their gold?
password_questions.hint: The newspaper mentions where outlaws stash their loot

password_questions.question: Who guards this bank?
password_questions.hint: Look at the bank ledger for the official guardian's name

rooms.name: Bank Vault
rooms.description: You've made it! The vault is filled with stacks of gold bars, bags of coins, and strongboxes overflowing with cash. The gleam of gold fills the room. A back exit leads to freedom.

items.name: stacks of gold bars
items.description: Gleaming bars of pure gold, worth a fortune

items.name: bags of gold coins
items.description: Heavy canvas bags filled with gold and silver coins

items.name: open strongbox
items.description: A metal box overflowing with paper currency

rooms.win_message: SUCCESS! You've broken into the Dusty Gulch Bank vault and secured the gold! Time to ride off into the sunset before the sheriff returns. You win, partner!
